definition: to borrow a light (for a cigarette)
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.english: Excuse me. Could you give me a light?
Can I trouble you for a light?
sentences.chinese: 麻煩您讓我借火用一下，行嗎？

sentences.english: Children must not smoke in front of their parents, not to its asking for a light or energize.
sentences.chinese: 子女絕不能在父母面前抽菸，更不能向其借火或接火。

sentences.english: A man wants to smoke a cigarette, but he has no match. He asks a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 一個人要抽菸卻沒有火柴，他向一個陌生人借火。

definition: see 打火機|打火机[da3 huo3 ji1]
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
lighter/cigarette lighter
match (for lighting fire)/CL:根[gen1],盒[he2]
to make a fire/to light a fire
to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
cigarette/cigar
to smoke (a cigarette, tobacco)
to hit on someone/to strike up a conversation/to start talking to end an awkward silence or embarrassing situation
to ask for directions/to ask the way (to some place)
to ignite/to burn
